summary.para:
Indicates all maps that forms the each intersection. The pattern will be like:
.-------.-------.-------. | C C C | A A A | A A A | | B B B | . . . | . . . | | B B B | . . . | . . . | '-------'-------'-------'
In addition, in this data structure, "_coverSet" is a block and "_baseSet" is a line.

summary.para: Indicates whether the specified cell is a bivalue cell.
Note that given and modifiable cells always make this method return .

member.param: ( parameter) The result mask. The mask consists of 9 bits, where the set bits means the digit exists in this cell; otherwise, the bit will not be set.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Data.Extensions.ReadOnlyGridEx.Exists(Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Indicates whether the specified grid contains the digit in the specified cell.
The return value will be if and only if the cell is empty and contains that digit.

member.remarks:
The cases of the return value are below:
The cell is an empty cell and contains the specified digit.
The cell is an empty cell but doesn't contain the specified digit.
The cell is not an empty cell.
member.example: Note that the method will return a ?, so you should use the code grid.Exists(candidate) is true or grid.Exists(candidate) == true to decide whether a condition is true.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.Grid._masks
member.summary: Binary masks of all cells.

remarks.para: This array stores binary representation of decimals.

There are 81 cells in a sudoku grid, so this data structure uses an array of size 81. Each element is a value (but only use 12 bits), where the lower 9 bits indicates whether the digit 1 to 9 exists or not. If the corresponding value is , or in other words, the binary representation is 1, this digit will not exist.

The higher 3 bits indicates the cell status. The cases are below:
0b001 (1) The cell is .
0b010 (2) The cell is .
0b100 (4) The cell is .

member.permission: The current project or the derived class can access this field.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.Grid._initialMasks
member.summary: Same as , but this field stores the all masks at the initial grid. The field will not be modified until this instance destructs.
member.permission: The current project or the derived class can access this field.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Data.Grid.Parse(System.String,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Parses a string value and converts to this type.

If you want to parse a PM grid, you should decide the mode to parse. If you use compatible mode to parse, all single values will be treated as given values; otherwise, recommended mode, which uses '<d>' or '*d*' to represent a value be a given or modifiable one. The decision will be indicated and passed by the second parameter .

summary.para: Indicates the output should be with candidates. If the output is single line, the candidates will indicate the candidates-have-eliminated before the current grid status; if the output is multi-line, the candidates will indicate the real candidate at the current grid status.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.GridMap.CoveredRegions
member.summary: Indicates all regions covered. This property is used to check all regions that all cells of this instance covered. For examp;le, if the cells are { 0, 1 }, the property will return the region 0 (block 1) and region 9 (row 1); however, if cells spanned two regions or more (e.g. cells { 0, 1, 27 }), this property will not contain any regions.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.GridMap.Regions
member.summary: All regions that the map spanned. This property is used to check all regions that all cells of this instance spanned. For example, if the cells are { 0, 1 }, the property will return the region 0 (block 1), region 9 (row 1), region 18 (column 1) and the region 19 (column 2).

summary.para: Indicates all cell offsets whose corresponding value are set .

member.name: T:Sudoku.Data.GridParsingOption
member.summary: Represents a grid parsing type.

summary.para: Indicates the susser format, which means all grid values will be displayed in one line with empty cell character '0' or '.'.
Indicates the pencil marked grid (PM grid), which means all grid candidates will be displayed using a table.
Indicates the pencil marked grid (PM grid), which means all grid candidates will be displayed using a table. In addition, all single digit will be treated as a given digit.
Indicates the table format, which means all grid values will be displayed using a table with empty cell character '0' or '.'.
Sudoku explainer format (9 characters in a row, and 9 rows).
Sukaku sudoku format (only contains the digits and the whitespace).
Sukaku single line format, which uses '0' to be a placeholder.
Excel sudoku format (only contains the digits and the tab character).

For example:
1 7 8 9 4 5 6 4 5 6 1 2 3 7 8 9 7 8 9 4 5 6 1 2 9 1 2 6 8 3 4 3 4 5 6 7 8 7 8 3 5 9 1 2 9 1 5 6 7 2 3 4 2 3 4 8 9 1 5 6 7 5 6 7 2 3 4 1
(Due to the rendering engine of IDE, all spaces will be displayed only once in this table.)

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.Value(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a digit into a cell.
member.param: The cell offset you want to get or set.
member.value: The digit you want to set. This value should be between 0 and 8. In addition, if your input is -1, the candidate mask in this cell will be re-computed. If your input is none of them above, this indexer will do nothing.
member.returns: An value indicating the result. If the current cell does not have a digit (i.e. The cell is ), The value will be -1.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.Value(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a candidate existence case with a value.
member.value: The case you want to set. means that this candidate does not exist in this current sudoku grid; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.ToArray
member.summary: Serializes this instance to an array, where all digit value will be stored.
member.returns: This array. All elements are between 0 to 9, where 0 means the cell is now.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.GetMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a mask of the specified cell.
member.param: The cell offset you want to get.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.GetCandidateMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the candidate mask part of the specified cell.
member.param: The cell offset you want to get.
member.returns: The candidate mask. The return value is a 9-bit value, where the bit will be 0 if the corresponding digit does not exist in the cell, and will be 1 if the corresponding contains this digit (either the cell is filled with this digit or the cell is an empty cell, whose candidates contains the digit).
member.remarks: Please note that the grid masks is represented with bits, where 0 is for the digit containing in a cell, 1 is for the digit not containing. However, here the return mask is the reversal: 1 is for containing and 0 is for not.
